moves.1. e4 c5: My favorite opening; the Sicilian Defence. I am rather disappointed that the next move does not comply with any variation of this opening.
moves.2. Bc4: I am not sure what I was thinking with this move. Maybe I was trying to prevent 2...c4, which Black would never do. This is a critical mistake in an opening in my opinion.
moves.2... Nc6: Black was expecting 3.d4, a very sorrowful mistake. Better safe than sorry because as White, I would never think of playing that move.
moves.3. Nc3: Black observed this move for a while, and he probably realized that I put a third attacker for d5. Black, apparently, had a mind of his own.
moves.3... e5: This game is really out of control. Both me and my opponent were trying to take over the middle d squares.
moves.4. Nf3 Nf6: Black looks like he is lagging in the opening a bit.
moves.5. Bd5: I am not sure whether I, if I wanted a piece on d5, should have done 5.Nd5, or this move. Maybe I should have forgotten about the d5 square and instead play 5.d3.
moves.5... Nd4: Breakthrough for Black, but not accurate enough.
moves.6. Nxe5: Black left his pawn in boiling soup, and the burner was not turned off! I shocked Black with this move.
moves.6... Bd6: Blind Black decides to ignore my Bishop and attack my knight. Big mistake.
moves.7. Nxf7: Black looked at this sensational move that I performed. It won his rook AND won the game.
moves.7... Qe7 8. Nxh8: UCM (unidentied crushing move) coming after this.
moves.8... Qe5: Black is not yet close to pulverizing my highly guarded center.
moves.9. g3: Even though I missed 9.Nd7, I looked at the opportunity to weaken Black.
moves.10. Qxf3: Now my Queen leaps into action, and I don't have much time to waste.
moves.10... g6: What was the purpose of this move.
moves.11. Nf7: Here it is finally, my UCM!
moves.11... Qd4: You can't bomb a central attack unless you really want to see what will happen to your position.
moves.13. Nf7+ Ke7: Now, I change my mind about 12...Ke7 and even playing it right now!
moves.14. e5: ! Forces the Black knight to trigger the trap; by taking my Bishop!
moves.14... Nxd5 15. Nxd5+ Ke8: Now, it's White to move and forced mate in two.
moves.16. Nd6+ Kd8 17. Qf8#: Good game, Black. Black played several mistakes that add up to five words: holding on to useless gains. Black tries too hard to hang on to his pieces, resulting in a collapsing position.
